result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Scott Sellers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Scott Sellers appeared by phone.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Steven Scott Sellers.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/14/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Steven Scott Sellers appeared by phone.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Steven Scott Sellers.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Scott Sellers in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Steven Scott Sellers.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defense counsel informs court that he is still awaiting discovery materials. Court adjourns case for a Scheduling Conference to Br 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 081267,
Payable Number: 1028028,
Receipt Number: 22RP034174,
Amount: $20.00

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/03/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TRH.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.

Defendant Steven Scott Sellers in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
